thread.title: Justin Bieber Won Pretty Much Everything at the 2015 MTV EMAs
thread.title_full: Justin Bieber Won Pretty Much Everything at the 2015 MTV EMAs

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Justin Bieber Won Pretty Much Everything at the 2015 MTV EMAs
text:
Share Tweet Pin E-mail Getty Kevin Mazur Advertisement - Continue Reading Below After taking home a total of five awards from the MTV Europe Music Awards 2015, Justin Bieber was clearly the biggest winner at tonight's (October 25) ceremony. The 21-year-old star won Best Male, Best Worldwide Act: North America, and even beat the likes of One Direction and Taylor Swift to take home the award for Biggest Fans.
MTV EMAs 2015: All the night's winners
Rounding out his total were the awards for Best Look and Best Collaboration for 'Where Are You Now?' with Skrillex and Diplo.
More From Cosmopolitan Other winners at the event held in Milan, Italy include One Direction for Best Pop, Nicki Minaj for Best Hip Hop and Taylor Swift ft Kendrick Lamar for Best Song with 'Bad Blood'.
Singer and songwriter Ed Sheeran, who hosted the event alongside Orange is the New Black actress Ruby Rose , also took home two awards for Best Live Act and Best World Stage for his performance at 2014's V Festival in Hylands Park.
Tonight's MTV EMAs were presented live from the Mediolanum Forum in Milan, and featured performances from winners Sheeran and Bieber, as well as Ellie Goulding, Pharrell Williams, Jason Derulo, Macklemore & Ryan Lewis and Jess Glynne.
